abstract: Victims of May Amtrak train derailment outside Philadelphia face possibility that they will not be adequately compensated for their injuries due to provision in 1997 Amtrak reauthorization bill capping railroad's liability at $200 million for any single accident; many have filed lawsuits against company in hopes of being awarded more.
lead_paragraph: The company says it will not contest lawsuits filed against it for the accident on May 12, but a federal cap on damages may leave victims with enormous bills.

headline.main: Limit on Damages Is Squeezing Victims of Amtrak Wreck
headline.print_headline: Limit on Damages Is Squeezing Victims of Amtrak Wreck

snippet: The company says it will not contest lawsuits filed against it for the accident on May 12, but a federal cap on damages may leave victims with enormous bills.
